entry.title: Re: Attachments in PR & PO
entry.content:
Hi,

Attachments are managed separately via the Attachment Service (Generic Object Services - GOS) and are not directly linked to the procurement BAdIs or standard business object structures. Hence, the system cannot validate or enforce attachment requirements during PR/PO creation or update via standard configuration. 

Kindly refer to the KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/0003664699

SAP Customer Influence enables customers to submit improvement requests and to openly vote on them.

These voting results inform SAP of product enhancements and changes customers are most interested in seeing in future releases.

1. Get started by opening SAP Customer Influence SAP Continuous Influence sessions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

2. Register and accept the Terms of Use

3. Choose a session of your interest

4. Create and submit your improvement request

5. Take a look at existing improvement requests and start voting and commenting

Thanks and regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: BGRFC Error- Server group does not get resources (may...
entry.content:
3235593 - "Server group does not get resources (may be incorrectly configured)" error in SBGRFCMON - SAP for Me

Error in SBGRFCMON:

In my Inbound Scenario, the inbound queue used (that may be a problem to know which one is concerned, so you may need to check all of them) was assigned to the server group "parallel_generators" (in the transaction SBGRFCCONF > Define Inbound Destinations):

The problem was that the server group "parallel_generators" wasn't in green state in the transaction RZ12 (because its unique assigned server "Instance" was incorrect):

After changing the application server name in RZ12, its state became green in RZ12.

In SBGRFCMON, delete the destination lock, it tries to get resources and the destination gets green if it's fine:

PS: the note says also to restart the bgRFC scheduler (2839871 - How to restart the bgRFC Scheduler - SAP for Me) by setting the number of schedulers to zero in transaction SBGRFCCONF > Scheduler App Server, then revert back to their initial values (-1 in my case) but that was not the problem in my case:

PS: the note says also to check the configuration in transaction SARFC, but I didn't see anything weird, so I kept the original values:

entry.title: Re: TRM payment reference in Transaction Manager
entry.content:
Hello @slucic 

Currently, there is no published ETA for a Payment Reference (KID) field in TRM, as previously mentioned by Ownen in 'Payment Details' in S/4HANA public cloud, and no configuration switch is available to enable it.

As you noted, this limit applies to the use of TRM payment requests for fully automated payments where the KID/structured creditor reference is mandatory.

What to do in the meantime, as verified by the tenant

AP/AR route recommended. Include the creditor reference on the invoice or open item and pay via Manage Automatic Payments; the mapping then transfers it into the payment file. SAP Help Portal-Manage Automatic Payments

Enter the reference in a manual payment app and map it to the KID/structured creditor reference in Map Format Data for Payments. SAP Help Portal-Manage Automatic Payments: FAQ

If TRM must remain the source, generate an AP open item that includes the reference, then add it to the automatic payment run. (KBA below shows how missing references appear in payments.)

KBA-3198883 - Payment Reference Empty in the Manage Automatic Payments App

KBA-3521658 - KIDNO (Payment Reference) Field Not Updating in Bank Line Item During Document Parking

SAP Help-What's New in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508-Configuration for Payment Reference

SAP Help-Invoice Management-Configuring Payment Medium Formats

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: How to integrate SAP Cloud ALM and Azure DevOps
entry.content:
Hello,

We are currently wanted to implement Azure DevOps connection to SAP Cloud ALM and we wanted to do a Proof of Concept. What are the step that we follow for the integration Azure DevOps with SAP Cloud ALM? After integration, how do we do an end to end test in SAP Cloud ALM? We need to set some functional goal. Please refer us to any SAP Note where we can get the steps for How to do the integration, and specifically what are the step we need to do in SAP Cloud ALM and Azure DevOps.

Thanks


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to integrate SAP Cloud ALM and Azure DevOps
entry.content:
Currently the only official documentation regarding integration directly with Azure DevOps is a blog by one of our Developers focusing on replicating SAP Cloud ALM Tasks/User Stories/Defects into an Azure DevOps Work Item. It illustrates and end-to-end configuration, and test scenario. 

SAP Cloud ALM External API Management allows you to make REST API requests to your any external software (including Azure DevOps), for activities like SAP Cloud ALM Tasks, etc. We also permit the replication of SAP Cloud ALM Features via External API Management functionality. However, we only provide a "built-in" Mapping (a pre-packaged template) for transforming SAP Cloud ALM Tasks/User Stories/ Defects into Azure DevOps Work Items. If you wish to replicate SAP Cloud ALM Features into your Azure DevOps instance, you would first need to select a document type in Azure DevOps to serve as the "receiver" of the SAP Cloud ALM data. Then you would need to create a Custom mapping from scratch to transform the SAP Cloud ALM Feature API data into the relevant Azure DevOps "receiver" document type you select.

If further assistance is required, you must contact a consulting organization to help you with performing the integration steps as this is a purely consulting topic. If you wish for more integration options that could align with Azure DevOps functionality, log a request using the SAP Customer Influence campaigns for SAP Cloud ALM via KBA 3391676 - SAP Continuous Influence for SAP Cloud ALM.

entry.title: Re: Business Goal percentage not calculating correctly
entry.content:
Hi @LeslieLessig19 

This behavior is expected. If the sum of you business goals weights does equal 100%, you will not have a match between the section target amount weight and the payout.

The path for calculation is as follows :

1. Prorated Target Amount > gets multiplied by section weight > gets multiplied by each business goal weight to make up each business goal target amount. 

2. Each Business goal target amount gets multiplied by the achievement of the business goal and the sum of all these payouts for all goals makes up the business goal section payout for the assignment.

 

 

The only workaround is through customization.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Re: User Management with FUE
entry.content:
Hi @barrysnow,

After an extensive time of consultation and technical work, I can say that there is no recipe to keep the FUE count to a minimum. However, the experience dictates that constant access reviews is key to ensure that only the right users have access to the system, and that each user will have the appropriate level of access.

In other words, performing a review of users every month to identify and disable leavers or users that don't need access for the time being is essential to maintain the numbers to a minimum. On the other hand, the company needs to consider moving to the next licensing tier if keeping the current one is no longer possible.

I hope this helps.

entry.title: Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion (UCFC)/CustOnTmp
entry.content:
What is CustOnTmp : The downtime-optimized conversion (doC) executes the FIN data conversion on the temporary instance during the uptime. For this, SUM needs the FIN Customizing to apply it prior to the data conversion. Until now, this required a standard conversion run prior to each doC run. In this standard run, the FIN Customizing was created and added to a transport request. Such a transport request is required to be provided to each doC run.

With the new feature Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion, FIN delta Customizing activities can be performed directly on the temporary instance of the doC run. With this, the number of required standard conversion runs is reduced to one standard conversion at the beginning of the project. All FIN delta Customizing activities can be directly done on the temporary instance of the doC run. For each new doC iteration, the initial FIN Customizing transport request is used (created in standard conversion) together with all the delta Customizing transport requests prepared with each new iteration.  It is no longer required to always run a standard conversion before each doC cycle

Prerequisites 

  • Target release SAP S/4HANA 2022 (or higher)
  • DOC with database migration (so no in place conversion; migration is possible also for source on SAP HANA)
  • SUM 2.0 SP 23 (or higher)

Differences Between Standard doC and Uptime Customizing

The uptime customizing will by default add most application tables to the uptime handling automatically. This means, the manual selection of tables for uptime migration becomes mostly obsolete. The SUM will no longer display the respective section on downtime-optimized DMO (with file specification "table list"). If there are still tables which cause a significant runtime during phase EU_CLONE_MIG_DT_RUN they can still be added manually using CRRTABLIST.LST as in regular doC approach.

Every application table in uptime handling gets either a replication trigger or a freeze trigger in the source system.

The reasons for a freeze trigger are:

  • Customizing table with delivery class C, E or G
  • Static classification in SUM which requires a read-only restriction

Freeze Trigger 

Freeze triggers are needed to ensure the consistency of the uptime conversion. Freeze triggers are used in 3 different ways as below

  • Hard Freeze 

Freeze triggers are used to prevent customizing changes in the source system which might influence and invalidate the uptime conversion which is done in parallel to production on the temporary instance. This means that the number of freeze tables is significantly higher as in regular doC approach, although it should not add additional business restrictions as most of the freeze triggers are defined on pure customizing table which are not changed directly in a productive system. Nevertheless, the Impact analysis is of a higher importance for the doC with Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion approach. The hard freeze will be activated during the preparation in phase SQLDB_FREEZE_TRIG_MODE_SWITCH_SMIG_TCR and will remain until the end of the doC procedure.

Please refer the   to SAP Note 2481983 - SUM Impact Analysis for downtime-optimized DMO

  • Temporary Freeze 

Some tables only be set read-only for a short period of time, for example while the Asset Accounting is prepared for the Uptime Conversion.

  • Freeze on Temporary System 

There will be freeze triggers used on the temporary instance between the SUM phases RUN_SMIG_SFIN_CUST_ON_TEMP_FREEZE and RUN_SMIG_SFIN_CUST_ON_TEMP_FREEZE_REV.

As tables must only be changed either by production operation (business users on system) on source system or by the customizing activities on the temporary system, all tables which can be changed by production operation will be set to read-only on the temporary system to avoid conflicting changes. It is, therefore, possible that a Customizing activity on the temporary instance fails with a short dump. In this case, create an incident  on component BC-UPG-DTM-TLA to clarify the access.

Some tables can be changed on source system and temporary system. Additionally, it is ensured that this does not cause a conflict or there is a special handling implementation like for number ranges. For more information, refer to section 3.1 Number Ranges in this SAP Note.

Execution 

During each doC execution, you must check in phase REQ_DOCMAX_DELTA_CUSTOMIZING that the provided FIN customizing that was added via CTI buffer is still valid.

doC with Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion allows to add additional Customizing directly shortly before the uptime phase PARRUN_SMIG_SFIN. To do so, perform the following steps:

  1. SUM will stop in dialog phase‚ÄØREQ_DOCMAX_DELTA_CUSTOMIZING.
  2. Perform the IMG activities listed under "IMG/Conversion of Accounting to SAP S/4HANA / Preparations and Migration of Customizing" in each relevant client. Use transaction SPRO in the respective clients to perform the needed customizing steps.
    Note: to identify if there are any delta customizing activities required, the customizing activities must be executed step by step (this information can't be provided by the tool).

        Remark: The Customizing activities must be strictly restricted to the required Finance conversion Customizing.                                         3.  Start the uptime FIN conversion by continuing SUM

 Restricted tables for Uptime Handling

The following tables must not be added manually to uptime using CRRTABLIST.LST to avoid potential issues during Delta Customizing for the S/4HANA Finance Conversion.

BALHDR, BALDAT and BAL_INDX

Customizing on the Temporary Instance

  • Preparation of Number Range ‚ÄúRF_BELEG‚Äù for New Document Type for Postings in Controlling

When using the Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion approach, the preparation of data migration requires a new document type for postings in Controlling that considers also a new number range object ‚ÄúRF_BELEG‚Äù.

Available options for Number Range Number definition for controlling document type:

  • In target system(S/4HANA):After SFIN Data Migration completion, before releasing the system to business users (the recommended one)
  • During S/4HANA Standard Customizing preparation with the inclusion into the FI customizing transport request of the CO number ranges numbers;

In source system (ECC): Before the start of S/4HANA technical activities

  • Preparations and Migration of Customizing for Controlling

Maintain Operating Concern (KEA0)‚Äù on the temporary instance is not possible due to read-only restriction on table TKES2 and CEFORMT. Execute ‚ÄúMaintain Operating Concern‚Äù only after SFIN delta migration is completed, as an after-migration activity, outside of SUM tool.

Restrictions

Depreciation calculation: Due to a read-only restriction on table T093D it is not allowed to run depreciation calculation when triggers are active in the system. This restriction only applies if table T093D is a logical pool table. If a mitigation is needed for this restriction you can get in contact with SUM development team raising an incident on BC-UPG-DTM-TLA.

 

Reference Notes:

3428570 - Executing and Monitoring Downtime-Optimized Conversion to SAP S/4HANA with Customizing on Temporary System


3388323 Executing and Monitoring Downtime-Optimized Conversion to SAP S/4HANA with SUM 2.0 SP 19

Other Important Links :

SAP Support Portal: http://support.sap.com/sltoolset 

SAP Help Portal: Preprocessing | SAP Help Portal.

SAP Help Portal: Customizing Freeze | SAP Help Portal.

Downtime-Optimized Conversion (Doc) for SAP S/4HANA... - SAP Community

Re: Substitutions for Market segment using g/l account in...
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

You can configure S/4HANA Public Cloud to automatically assign the Product Sold Group during FI postings to Margin Analysis (CO-PA). This can be done either through a no-code substitution in the Accounting: Market Segment context or, if that field is not available in your tenant, by implementing a small BAdI in Custom Logic.

Open Manage Substitution/Validation Rules.

Business context: Accounting: Market Segment

Event: During Journal Entry Item

Rule type: Substitution

Condition (IF): G/L Account = your account (or use a list/range if you have more than one).

Action (THEN): Set Product Sold Group to the fixed value that corresponds to that G/L account (your 1:1 mapping).

Activate the rule and test by posting a simple journal entry to that G/L. In the posting‚Äôs Market Segment (profitability segment), confirm that Product Sold Group is filled automatically. You‚Äôll also see it reflected in profitability reports (Product Profitability).

If "Product Sold Group" appears in the rule‚Äôs target list, you are done; no code is needed.

Let me know how it goes

Chuma

entry.title: ADS job not free memory
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have a requirement to print a form with more than 15.000 pages.

Offcourse that must be done by background job.

If I try to print more than 1000 pages per job I get an error of adobe memory.

I've tried to split on multiple jobs, but the memory is not release and I get the same adobe memory error.

My code is:

FORM f_print_pdf.

  DATA: lt_dtab_pdf TYPE ty_datatab_pdf_t,
        lv_fname    TYPE funcname.

  DATA(lv_tot_lines) = lines( gt_dtab_pdf ).
  DATA(lv_pag_atual) = CONV i( 1 ).

  CALL FUNCTION 'FP_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME'
    EXPORTING
      i_name     = CONV fpname( 'ZFI_MAP' )
    IMPORTING
      e_funcname = lv_fname.

  WHILE lv_actual_pag LE lv_total_lines.
    REFRESH lt_dtab_pdf.
    LOOP AT gt_dtab_pdf FROM lv_actual_page TO ( lv_actual_page + 999 )
                        ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<wa_dtab_pdf>).
      APPEND <wa_dtab_pdf> TO lt_dtab_pdf.
    ENDLOOP.

    PERFORM f_print_pdf_pages USING lv_fname
                                    lv_actual_page
                                    lv_total_lines
                                    lt_dtab_pdf.

    ADD 1000 TO lv_actual_page.
  ENDWHILE.

ENDFORM. " F_PRINT_PDF
FORM f_print_pdf_pages  USING pv_fname        TYPE funcname
                              pv_actual_page  TYPE i
                              pv_total_pages  TYPE i
                              pt_dtab_pdf     TYPE ty_datatab_pdf_t.

  DATA: ls_docparams    TYPE sfpdocparams,
        ls_outputparams TYPE sfpoutputparams,
        ls_formoutput   TYPE fpformoutput,
        ls_result       TYPE sfpjoboutput.

    ls_outputparams-nodialog  = 'X'.
    ls_outputparams-preview   = space.
    ls_outputparams-reqnew    = 'X'.
    ls_outputparams-reqfinal  = 'X'.
    ls_outputparams-covtitle  = sy-cprog.
    ls_outputparams-dest      = 'ZLOC'.

  CALL FUNCTION 'FP_JOB_OPEN'
    CHANGING
      ie_outputparams = ls_outputparams
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS          = 99.

  CHECK sy-subrc EQ 0.

  CALL FUNCTION pv_fname
    EXPORTING
      it_datatab        = pt_dtab_pdf
      iv_gjahr          = CONV gjahr( p_gjahr-low )
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS            = 99.

  CALL FUNCTION 'FP_JOB_CLOSE'
    IMPORTING
      e_result = ls_result
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS = 99.

ENDFORM. " F_PRINT_PDF_PAGES

The first time I do the loop it's ok. The second time I got the error: "Out of Memory Exception Stack Trace: com.adobe.ProcessingException".

Any idea why the FP_JOB_CLOSE doesn't clear the memory?

Thank you

entry.title: Re: CENTRAL BUSINESS CONFIGURATION DEFINE ASSET CLASS
entry.content:
Hello @maggie2 

If Go-Live Relevance is mandatory in CBC and the status is Open, complete or adopt the activity before going live. For Define Asset Classes, copy a delivered class, keep account determination, number range, and ensure depreciation areas are covered, then mark it Completed.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3e5fcf2c768746049b5627bd5a42f720/227f0f8f970a44f88d6c1b875971c306.html Asset Accounting in Public Cloud (CBC-connected setup)

SAP Learning (Public Edition) specifies Mandatory, Recommended, and Optional configuration activities; mandatory activities must be completed before going live. https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/configuring-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-for-manufacturing-execution/introducing-sap-central-business-configuration

KBA 3095410 confirms that you cannot edit SAP-delivered standard asset classes; instead, you must copy them to a Z class and maintain your settings there (account determination, number range, etc.). Ideal to back your guidance 3095410 - Edit standard Asset Classes in SSCUI - S/4HANA CLOUD 

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Stock Transfer With Delivery
entry.content:
Hello @Charisma_fitra 

Two-step transfers require PGI to post in ERP first; until IM status flips, GR in inbound delivery can not proceed. Refer to SAP Learning for a quick refresher on the differences between one-step and two-step behaviour. SAP Learning-Performing Stock Transfers Between Storage Locations

Useful SAP documentations 

  • KBA 3364977 ‚Äî Stuck queues/period change errors; GI status ‚ÄúA‚Äù. SAP Support Portal-3364977 - Error message about posting period shows up in Warehouse Monitor app
  • KBA 3578363 ‚Äî GI/GR posted in EWM but no update/no queue in ERP. SAP Support Portal-3578363 - ERP-relevant messages not sent from EWM
  • KBA 3520582 ‚Äî GI status inconsistency with no stuck queue. SAP Support Portal-3520582 - GI status inconsistency between EWM and S/4 ERP

Let me know if you need more information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Goods Receipt Slip when posting GR in Inbound delivery
entry.content:
Hello @Lucas2203 

Thank you for your question

Yes, you are right, PPF is not available in public cloud. The Output Management framework is used to print the Good Receipts Slip, which is done through GRPO Output Type.

You can enable it by using the Manage Output Parameter Determination app, then select Inbound Delivery and configure output type GRPO with: Channel = Print, Form Template = GOODS_RECEIPT_PO_SLIP.

Once you are done with that configuration, the slip is then generated automatically when you post Goods Receipts from the Change Inbound Deliveries.

Have a look at  Goods Receipt for Order, Output Parameter Determination  & Maintain Form Templates  for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Joule for Consultants: Listening, Learning, and Delivering
entry.content:
What if it was possible to cut down the time and effort required to implement a large scale digital transformation project without sacrificing quality? In theory, this would mean customers would see the value of their cloud investments materialize much faster than they are today.

That was the bet SAP made when it launched one of its premier Business AI innovations back in December 2024, SAP Joule for Consultants (J4C).  It is a generative AI copilot designed to transform how SAP consultants and partners implement SAP solutions and accelerate cloud transformations. It was born out of a vision where if we could harness the power of generative AI and combine it with SAP's comprehensive knowledge base and business data, we could create a ground-breaking tool that helps millions of SAP consultants augment their productivity, avoid time-consuming searches, and make better-informed decisions at every step of the transformation.

SAP Joule for Consultants is purpose-built as an AI copilot that can deliver concise answers, explain custom code, and provide expert-level best practice guidance. Grounded in SAP's proprietary knowledge base, consultants can rely on the information to be reliable, responsible, and relevant.

Since its General Availability (GA) launch in Q2 2025, product adoption has grown substantially and customers worldwide are beginning to utilize J4C across the various different phases of complex SAP implementation projects.

But GA was only the beginning. The product team has been listening carefully to the feedback from our early adopters, consultants in the field, and our broader SAP Community. The input so far has been incredibly valuable and is helping shape our future roadmap. A consistent theme we have heard is the need to keep enhancing both the Content available in J4C and the overall User Experience. These insights led us narrow our focus on tangible product improvements and has fundamentally guided the August and September product releases.

üöÄAugust Release

User Experience Capabilities:

üîçPrompt Guide with Examples

The new Prompt Guide with Examples helps consultants ask better questions. By clicking Show Prompt Guide above the conversation window, users can see best practices and sample prompts making it easier to frame queries and get better results.

üìöPrompt Library

Easily browse a collection of pre-formulated prompts tailored to common roles and areas within SAP. Use filters to find prompts by Role (e.g., Technology Consultant, Project Manager) or Area (e.g., Security Best Practices, ABAP Development).

Each prompt includes:

  • The actual prompt
  • A less effective alternative prompt
  • Prompt objective
  • Prompt description

To use a prompt, simply copy it from the library and paste it into the Joule Conversation box. This feature is accessible via a link in the Quick Prompt Guide.

üìãCopy Answer to Clipboard

In addition to the Code Copy you can now quickly copy the entire contents of the Joule answer box by clicking the Copy button. This makes it easy to share Joule‚Äôs responses for use in other applications or purposes.

Content Enhancements:

üìÑKnowledge Base Articles (Public)

 

Public Information from Knowledge-Based Articles is now integrated into SAP Joule for Consultants.

üíªJoule for Developers API Assistant

Cloud Content Migration (CCM)

SAP ABAP RESTful

üåêRefreshed Learning and Community Content

 

SAP Learning Journeys & Courses

SAP Community blogs, forums, and Q&A

SAP Roadmap content

üöÄSeptember Release

User Experience Capabilities:

‚ö°Quick Links: A central hub for frequently used features

When you are in the middle of a project, every click matters. Consultants told us that while the Prompt Guide was useful, it was too narrow in scope. They wanted a single-entry point where they could jump to whatever they needed most. That‚Äôs why we transformed the old ‚ÄúShow Prompt Guide‚Äù button into Quick Links, a central hub designed for speed. With one click, consultants can:

  • Access the Prompt Guide for quick how-to examples.
  • Open the Prompt Library for curated best practices.
  • Check What‚Äôs New to stay current with the latest updates.
  • Launch the Console to configure and monitor usage.

üñ•Ô∏è Control and Clarity with the J4C Console

J4C Console Overview: The new J4C Console brings visibility and control into one place with tailored capabilities for each role (User and Admin).

For All Users: An effortless way to stay on top of what‚Äôs new with each release and the Prompt Library to browse and access curated prompts directly from the console.

For Administrators: Admins can use the Console to gain tenant-level insights with Usage Metrics, for tracking adoption and engagement across users, and adjust organizational preferences through Settings, such as starter messages to customize how teams experience J4C.

 

Content Enhancements:

üìöKBA and SAP Notes

Access made simple: Entitlement-based access for end-users.

Flexible control: Admins decide who gets access by assigning s-users.

No extra steps: End-users don‚Äôt need to act.

üîíPrivate Content

The SAP Simplification List is a release-specific guide that outlines changes in SAP S/4HANA, detailing which legacy features are removed or replaced and what new solutions take their place. It helps customers and partners understand system impacts, plan conversions, and adopt S/4HANA innovations smoothly.

IMG is a structured guide that provides documentation and activities for adapting standard SAP functions. Users navigate through a hierarchical structure to select and implement desired configurations, ensuring the system functions correctly for their organization.

üåêContent Refresh

Richer insights from SAP Learning & SAP Help.

Access to SAP News & AI Feature Catalogue.

More detailed and comprehensive guidance.

üöÄLooking Ahead: We have an ambitious roadmap for the remainder of 2025 and you can expect regular fixes, new capabilities, and innovations. Thank you to SAP colleagues, consultants, and the community for your input and support. Together, we‚Äôre shaping the future of AI-powered consulting, guided by your feedback and continuously improving with every release.

entry.title: Re: Data Quality with Artificial Intelligence (AI)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"Data Cleansing: AI algorithms can identify consistent data patterns, thereby identify data anomalies, correct data errors, missing values. Machine learning models can learn from historical data patterns to predict and fill any missing information.

Data Matching and Deduplication: AI techniques, such as fuzzy matching and clustering algorithms, can identify and merge duplicate records, even when they are not exact matches. This helps in maintaining a single, accurate version of each data entity.

Data Enrichment: AI can enhance data by integrating additional information from external sources. For example, machine learning models can analyse customer data to predict demographic attributes or purchasing behaviour, enriching the existing dataset with valuable insights."

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

 

üôÇ

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: Re: Inspection results and specifications from the Semi-F...
entry.content:
Hi @Sindhu_Ravi 

Thank you for your question

In S4HPC, COA retrieves inspection results and specifications from the inspections lot that is associated with the delivered material. Based on your description, the finished goods are referenced. The standard functionality does not allow sourcing results directly from another material‚Äôs inspection lot.

If most of your testing is done at the SFG level, you can handle it in two ways:

  1. You can use QM in production copy control to copy relevant result from the SFG inspection lot into the FG inspection lot. Doing that will ensure FG‚Äôs lot contains the SFG‚ÄôS results.
  2. You can use Custom Logic to extend the CoA form to pull inspection results from the SFG lot which is linked through the production order relationship.

Have a look at Quality Certificates, Form Templates & Inspection Lots and Results Recording for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Learn more about Fiscalization 2.0 in Croatia: e-invoicing (B2B) , fiscalization and e-reporting
entry.content:
Regulatory Changes  As part of the "Fiscalization 2.0" project and starting January 2026, the Croatian government is introducing B2B e-invoicing, e-reporting and fiscalization requirements. 

  • B2B/B2G e-invoicing: all businesses with VAT registration in Croatia need to send electronic invoices in the required format through an approved service provider.
  • Fiscalization: 
    • B2B/B2G invoices: issuer and receiver of e-invoices need to send the fiscal data of the invoice to authorities (digitally signed XML). 
    • B2C invoices: issuer of the e-invoice needs to send fiscal to authorities irrespective of payment method (currently required only for cash payments). 
  • E-reporting: in addition to invoicing data (fiscalization), the following reporting requirements need to be fulfilled: 
    • List of collected invoices (payment received), during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer. 
    • List of outbound deliveries for which e-invoice could not be delivered, during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer. 
    • List of rejected invoices, during reporting period (month) for invoice recipient. 

The first e-reporting submission deadline is Feb 20, 2026, for the month of January 2026. This is the date by when all invoice statuses (rejected / not delivered as recipient is not in the ‚Äòaddress book‚Äô) and payments received need to be sent, but they can be sent continuously during the period invoice by invoice. 

Planned SAP Solution SAP plans to support businesses in meeting these new requirements leveraging‚ÄØSAP Document and Reporting Compliance.‚ÄØThis cloud-based solution offers end-to-end compliance for more than 55 countries, natively embedded into the ERP, without the need for data replication and reconciliation. 
To find our more and see in action how regulatory requirements in Croatia will be supported, mark your calendar on‚ÄØOctober 16, 2025, at 3:30pm CET‚ÄØand‚ÄØjoin our webinar‚ÄØcovering the new Fiscalization, B2B e-Invoicing,‚ÄØand e-Reporting requirements in Croatia.  Register today‚ÄØand you'll:‚ÄØ 

  • Gain insight on upcoming regulatory mandates 
  • Understand how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance supports these changes 
  • Learn how to prepare your system with necessary implementation and configuration‚ÄØ 

Share with your peers, the webinar is free and can also be watched on demand afterwards.  

Delivery Status  Please monitor Regulatory Change Manager application to stay updated about the planned scope, delivery timeline and solution details: 

  • ‚ÄØB2B e-invoicing‚ÄØfor domestic customer invoice and supplier invoice, last mile provider required: link  
  • ‚ÄØSend Fiscalization data‚ÄØto tax authorities:‚ÄØlink 
  • ‚ÄØe-reporting‚ÄØpresenting list of collected invoices during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer:‚ÄØlink 

More information 

  • Official publication of the‚ÄØFiscalization Act in the official Gazette (in Croatian) 
  • Legal changes published by Tax Authority (in Croatian):

entry.title: Client-Side Column Encryption fails in Cloud Foundry (JDBC) with -11503
entry.content:
Summary
A Java app running on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry connects to SAP HANA over TLS without issues, but any query that touches client-side encrypted columns fails with:
 
SAP DBTech JDBC: [11503]: Column encryption key with ID <cek-uuid-redacted> could not be retrieved from the server.
No local client key pairs have access to this key.
 
Unencrypted queries work. The exact same PKCS#12 + PIN decrypts the same column via hdbsql on the origin machine and returns valid plaintext, so the key material in the CF app is correct and matches the CEK used by that column. In CF via JDBC it consistently ends in -11503, which looks like a generic ‚ÄúCSE not OK‚Äù gate rather than literally ‚Äúno local key pairs.‚Äù
 
Impact
‚Ä¢ All reads/writes that touch encrypted columns fail.
‚Ä¢ Features depending on those columns are effectively down.
‚Ä¢ Connectivity, TLS validation, and non-encrypted operations remain OK.
 
Environment
‚Ä¢ Platform: SAP BTP / Cloud Foundry (Java, SAP Java Buildpack, Tomcat)
‚Ä¢ Database: SAP HANA Cloud (single DB)
‚Ä¢ ORM: JPA / EclipseLink
‚Ä¢ JDBC driver: SAP HANA JDBC 2.25 (from runtime logs)
‚Ä¢ Service bindings (VCAP):
‚Äì HANA: <pp-schema-redacted>
‚Äì Credential Store: <pp-credstore-redacted>
‚Ä¢ Keystore: fetched at runtime from SAP Credential Store (mTLS + JWE), written to a temp file in CF; PIN retrieved separately from CredStore
‚Ä¢ CEK observed in error: <cek-uuid-redacted>
 
Current JDBC configuration (sanitized)
 
jdbc:sap://<db-id-redacted>.hana.prod-<region-redacted>.hanacloud.ondemand.com:443
  ?encrypt=true
  &validateCertificate=true
  &currentschema=<schema-redacted>
  &cseKeyStore=<temp-path-redacted>
  &cseKeyStorePassword=****    <-- PIN
  &cseKeyStoreType=PKCS12
  &cseKeyStoreAlias=init
  &traceFile=<trace-path-redacted>
  &traceLevel=3
  &traceOptions=CSE
 
Timeline / Evidence (sanitized)
1. Connectivity, TLS, driver init OK
Startup logs show:
‚Ä¢ HANA binding resolved: service <pp-schema-redacted>, database_id <db-id-redacted>
‚Ä¢ JDBC driver version 2.25
‚Ä¢ TLS on (encrypt=true, validateCertificate=true), server cert validation passed
2. Keystore from Credential Store loads and unlocks
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúInitializing CSCE from CredStore: binding <pp-credstore-redacted>, namespace <ns-redacted>‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúKeystore fetched: path cse-keystore-<random>.p12, size , pinPresent=true‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúLoaded entry: alias init, entryType=PrivateKeyEntry, unlockable=true‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Cert subject and SHA-256 fingerprint logged (masked)
3. Failure occurs when the driver retrieves CEK metadata
First query touching an encrypted column throws:
 
SQLNonTransientConnectionExceptionSapDB:
  Column encryption key with ID <cek-uuid-redacted> could not be retrieved from the server.
  No local client key pairs have access to this key. (Error -11503)
  at com.sap.db.jdbc.ConnectionSapDB.retrieveColumnEncryptionKey(...)
  at com.sap.db.jdbc.packet.HReplyPacket.getResultSetMetaData(...)
  at com.sap.db.jdbc.PreparedStatementSapDB._handlePrepareReply(...)
 
4. Minimal ‚ÄúPIN-only‚Äù configuration behaves the same
Tried the lean setup suggested in docs: only cseKeyStorePassword (PIN), omitting explicit keystore path/type/alias. Result is still -11503. This points away from path/alias/type resolution problems.
5. Ground truth: the very same key pair works with hdbsql
‚Ä¢ Using the same PKCS#12 + PIN on the origin Windows machine, hdbsql decrypts the target encrypted column and returns valid plaintext.
‚Ä¢ The same key pair imported into a fresh PKCS#12 on Linux and used in CF still results in -11503.
‚Ä¢ keytool -list -v confirms alias=init, private key present and unlockable, fingerprint consistent.
‚Üí The private keys in the app‚Äôs keystore on the server are exactly the same keys that successfully decrypt the column via hdbsql. They match the CEK for that column.
 
Notes
‚Ä¢ Earlier tests showed hdbkeystore Export produces a container not readable by keytool/openssl (meant for hdbkeystore re-import). That path is not used in CF.
 
What we‚Äôve tried (summary)
‚Ä¢ Verified TLS and connectivity.
‚Ä¢ Enabled CSE tracing (traceLevel=3, traceOptions=CSE).
‚Ä¢ Sourced keystore + PIN from Credential Store; also tested fresh PKCS#12 built on Linux.
‚Ä¢ Tested minimal ‚ÄúPIN-only‚Äù JDBC config.
‚Ä¢ Confirmed with hdbsql that the same key pair decrypts the same column successfully.
 
Findings
‚Ä¢ The keystore in CF loads; alias=init is a PrivateKeyEntry and unlocks with the PIN.
‚Ä¢ The failure appears exactly at the CEK retrieval/mapping step.
‚Ä¢ Error -11503 here likely serves as a generic ‚ÄúCSE chain not acceptable‚Äù signal.
‚Ä¢ Since hdbsql with the same key pair decrypts the same column, the key is valid and matches the CEK; the discrepancy is environmental/behavioral between CF+JDBC and the working hdbsql setup.
 
Open questions
1. Why does the exact same PKCS#12 + PIN combination decrypt the column with hdbsql but fail with JDBC in CF?
2. In this path, what does -11503 precisely represent‚Äîstrictly ‚Äúno matching recipient,‚Äù or any broader CSE precondition failure?
3. Which diagnostics would show the CEK metadata resolved by JDBC in CF and how it‚Äôs being matched to the client certificate?
4. Could schema/tenant/database context differ between CF and the origin machine, causing a different CEK or metadata to be used?
5. Are there driver/runtime specifics in CF (buildpack, JCE, deferredPrepare, etc.) that could change how the CEK/recipient mapping is evaluated?

entry.title: Re: Alert/notifications for managers about their direct r...
entry.content:
Hi @APO,

You may want to consider activating the "Enable Birthday and Work Anniversary Cards on the Latest Home Page" upgrade from the Upgrade Center.

This feature reminds managers of their team members' upcoming birthdays and work anniversaries with a card on the Home Page. A first reminder appears at the beginning of the month, and a second reminder is displayed on the day of the milestone. Importantly, no email notifications will be sent ‚Äì announcements will only be visible on the Home Page.

Here is some documentation you can review for reference:

Enabling Birthday and Work Anniversary Reminders on the Home Page

3152871 - Prerequisites for showing Birthday and Work Anniversary cards in latest Homepage

3116231 - Birthday and Work Anniversary Cards on the Latest Home Page

entry.title: Re: SAP Ariba User Provisioning Using SAP Identity Provisioning Service (IPS)
entry.content:
Is there any update to this that covers more realistically the first part of IAS, which is populating the users? Many companies today are using SuccessFactors as the source of IAS users via IPS; not Postman or file loads. 

Some of the code here needed seems incompatible with what is standard delivered from SF source with IAS target.

It seems difficult to populate custom schemas in IAS when SF is the source, plus other needs to be on IAS API v2 to accomplish some of these goals. 

Thank you

entry.content:

I'm working with R visualizations in SAP Analytics Cloud, but I've run into an issue. Along with the following warning message:

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: FM DATE_CHECK_PLAUSIBILITY checks User default date f...
entry.content:
My Sample program to explain about this FM

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report Z_DATE_PLAUSIBILITY_CHECK
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Simple program to demonstrate FM DATE_CHECK_PLAUSIBILITY
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT z_date_plausibility_check.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Data Declarations
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA: lv_date TYPE sy-datum,
lv_check_rule TYPE t009b-xperi,
lv_interval_years TYPE t009b-xperi VALUE 5,
lv_interval_months TYPE t009b-permo VALUE 12,
lv_return_code TYPE sy-subrc,
lv_message TYPE string.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Selection Screen
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-001.
PARAMETERS: p_date TYPE sy-datum DEFAULT sy-datum OBLIGATORY.
PARAMETERS: p_years TYPE numc2 DEFAULT 5,
p_months TYPE numc2 DEFAULT 12.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Initialization
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
INITIALIZATION.
TEXT-001 = 'Date Plausibility Check Parameters'.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Main Program
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.

WRITE: / 'Date Plausibility Check Program',
/ sy-uline(70).
SKIP 1.

" Display input parameters
WRITE: / 'Date to Check:', p_date DD/MM/YYYY.
WRITE: / 'Today''s Date:', sy-datum DD/MM/YYYY.
WRITE: / 'Year Tolerance:', p_years, 'years'.
WRITE: / 'Month Tolerance:', p_months, 'months'.
SKIP 1.
WRITE: / sy-uline(70).

" Call the function module
CALL FUNCTION 'DATE_CHECK_PLAUSIBILITY'
EXPORTING
date = p_date
date_for_check = sy-datum
* DISPLAY = ' '
* FACTORY_CALENDAR = ' '
IMPORTING
plausibility_check_failed = lv_return_code
EXCEPTIONS
plausibility_check_failed = 1
OTHERS = 2.

SKIP 1.

" Check the result
CASE sy-subrc.
WHEN 0.
" Date is plausible
WRITE: / '‚úì Result: Date is PLAUSIBLE',
/ 'The date passed the plausibility check.',
/ 'This date can be used in business transactions.'.
FORMAT COLOR COL_POSITIVE.
WRITE: / 'STATUS: OK'.
FORMAT COLOR OFF.

WHEN 1.
" Date is not plausible
WRITE: / '‚úó Result: Date is NOT PLAUSIBLE',
/ 'The date failed the plausibility check.',
/ 'This date is outside acceptable range.'.
FORMAT COLOR COL_NEGATIVE.
WRITE: / 'STATUS: ERROR'.
FORMAT COLOR OFF.

" Show reason
SKIP 1.
WRITE: / 'Possible reasons:'.
IF p_date < sy-datum.
WRITE: / '- Date is too far in the PAST'.
ELSE.
WRITE: / '- Date is too far in the FUTURE'.
ENDIF.

WHEN OTHERS.
WRITE: / '? Result: UNEXPECTED ERROR',
/ 'An unexpected error occurred during check.'.
FORMAT COLOR COL_TOTAL.
WRITE: / 'STATUS: UNKNOWN'.
FORMAT COLOR OFF.
ENDCASE.

" Additional date analysis
SKIP 1.
WRITE: / sy-uline(70).
WRITE: / 'Additional Analysis:'.

DATA: lv_diff_days TYPE i.
lv_diff_days = p_date - sy-datum.

IF lv_diff_days = 0.
WRITE: / '- Date is TODAY'.
ELSEIF lv_diff_days > 0.
WRITE: / '- Date is', lv_diff_days, 'days in the FUTURE'.
ELSE.
lv_diff_days = lv_diff_days * -1.
WRITE: / '- Date is', lv_diff_days, 'days in the PAST'.
ENDIF.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Example with Multiple Test Cases
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
TOP-OF-PAGE.
WRITE: / 'SAP Date Plausibility Check - Demo Program',
/ 'Report: Z_DATE_PLAUSIBILITY_CHECK',
/ sy-uline(70).
SKIP 1.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Test Different Scenarios (Optional - Comment out if not needed)
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
END-OF-SELECTION.
SKIP 2.
WRITE: / sy-uline(70).
WRITE: / 'TEST SCENARIOS:'.
WRITE: / sy-uline(70).
SKIP 1.

" Test Case 1: Current date
PERFORM check_date USING sy-datum 'Current Date (Today)'.

" Test Case 2: Very old date
PERFORM check_date USING '19900101' 'Very Old Date (1990)'.

" Test Case 3: Future date
DATA: lv_future TYPE sy-datum.
lv_future = sy-datum + 365.
PERFORM check_date USING lv_future 'One Year in Future'.

" Test Case 4: Far future date
PERFORM check_date USING '20500101' 'Far Future (2050)'.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Subroutine to check date
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM check_date USING p_test_date TYPE sy-datum
p_desc TYPE string.

DATA: lv_rc TYPE sy-subrc.

WRITE: / 'Testing:', p_desc.
WRITE: / 'Date:', p_test_date DD/MM/YYYY.

CALL FUNCTION 'DATE_CHECK_PLAUSIBILITY'
EXPORTING
date = p_test_date
date_for_check = sy-datum
IMPORTING
plausibility_check_failed = lv_rc
EXCEPTIONS
plausibility_check_failed = 1
OTHERS = 2.

IF sy-subrc = 0.
FORMAT COLOR COL_POSITIVE.
WRITE: / '‚Üí Result: PASSED ‚úì'.
FORMAT COLOR OFF.
ELSE.
FORMAT COLOR COL_NEGATIVE.
WRITE: / '‚Üí Result: FAILED ‚úó'.
FORMAT COLOR OFF.
ENDIF.

SKIP 1.

ENDFORM.

entry.title: Welcome to the Future: The 2H‚ÄØ2025 Home Page Redesign in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
SAP is gearing up to unveil a refreshed and enhanced Home Page experience as part of the 2H 2025 SuccessFactors release. This update aims to make the Home Page more intuitive, dynamic, and tailored to each user‚Äôs context ‚Äî helping reduce friction, speed up access to core tasks, and deliver a modern ‚Äúlanding pad‚Äù for day-to-day HR workflows.

 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Key Highlights & Enhancements

  1. Quick Actions ‚Äî smarter and more flexible

The Quick Actions section will be more context‚Äëaware, surfacing actions that are most relevant to each user (based on their permissions, modules, and usage patterns). You‚Äôll notice faster access to high-value tasks without navigating multiple screens.

SAP is also introducing integration of Quick Actions into SuccessFactors Work Zone ‚Äî bringing HR actions into the broader workplace context.

  1. Opt‚ÄëIn / Disable Controls

Some of the Home Page changes are opt-in or configurable, giving you control over timing and adoption. For organizations that prefer gradual rollout or selective adoption, this offers valuable flexibility.

  1. Visual & Layout Refinements

Expect cleaner layouts, more consistent card design, and an improved information hierarchy so that important items stand out.

  1. Better Support for Dynamic Content & Cards

Custom cards will get improved support for embedding iFrames, videos, and rich content ‚Äî providing greater flexibility. As with earlier redesigns, content will be dynamically driven ‚Äî only what is relevant to the user will appear.

Why This Matters ‚Äî Benefits to Your Organization

Benefit

Description

Enhance User Productivity

By surfacing relevant actions and reducing navigation steps, users get to their tasks faster.

Contextual Experience

The Home Page adapts to each user‚Äôs role, reducing noise and cognitive overload.

Modern Look & Feel

A refreshed interface aligns with contemporary standards and user expectations.

Scalable Customization

Embedded rich content and advanced card capabilities allow tailoring without heavy customization.

Controlled Adoption

Opt-in and configurable options let you manage change at your own pace.

Rollout Strategy: How to Plan Your Adoption

  1. Early Preview & Sandbox Testing ‚Äî Enable the new Home Page in test environments and gather feedback.
  2. Feature Mapping & Gap Analysis ‚Äî Map existing content to new cards and identify unsupported elements.
  3. Define Card Visibility & Prioritization ‚Äî Decide which cards show for each role and configure rules accordingly.
  4. Performance & UX Testing ‚Äî Test responsiveness across devices and monitor page loading times.
  5. User Communication & Training ‚Äî Provide clear communication, training, and guided tours.
  6. Staged Rollout / Opt-In Phases ‚Äî Start with pilot users before full rollout.
  7. Monitor, Iterate & Optimize ‚Äî Track feedback and analytics to fine-tune the experience.

Sample Narrative to Use Internally / Communicate to Users

We‚Äôre excited to bring you a refreshed Home Page in the 2H 2025 SuccessFactors update. This new version is smarter, cleaner, and more personalized ‚Äî putting the actions you use most front and center. Over the coming weeks, we‚Äôll roll this out to a pilot group, gather feedback, and gradually expand to all users.

Final Thoughts

The redesigned Home Page in the 2H 2025 release represents a meaningful evolution in how users interact with SuccessFactors. With careful planning, testing, and change management, organizations can make this transition seamless and impactful.

entry.title: Re: Investment Boost: A significant step to promote economic growth
entry.content:
Hi Bino

entry.title: Candidate Not Visible in Manage Pending Hires (MPH)
entry.content:
Hello SuccessFactors Experts,

I‚Äôm reaching out for assistance with an issue we‚Äôre encountering.

When a recruiter moves a candidate to the "Ready to Hire (EC)" status, the HR Manager is unable to view the candidate in the Manage Pending Hires (MPH) step. As per the customer‚Äôs defined process, these candidates are expected to bypass the pre-boarding (onboarding) process.

We have already reviewed the following KBAs, but they did not resolve the issue:

  • 2361603 ‚Äì Candidate placed in "Ready to Hire" status does not appear under Manage Pending Hires ‚Äì Recruiting Management
  • 2613694 ‚Äì Unable to see candidate in Manage Pending Hires for Recruiting ‚Äì Recruiting Management/Employee Central

Note: We have configured the HR Manager role with the Target Population set to "All (External Onboarding Users)", but the issue persists.

Any guidance or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you,
Vijay Gopu
